intro: Chrysothesium aureum, commonly known as the golden star orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers with a star-shaped pattern, which are typically borne on erect, slender stems. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its compact appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, loamy soil for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts of rare orchids.
